Body:
BC-SPOT-BJT22-COX 
    

      The Cox News Service spot news budget for Monday, June 22, 1998.
      c.1998 Cox News Service

   This is the Cox News Service spot news budget for Monday, June
22, 1998. We will update this budget at 6 p.m. EDT.

   Separate feature and commentary budgets move at 10 a.m. EDT
Monday-Friday. Separate sports and business budgets move at 5 p.m.
EDT Monday-Friday.

   If you have questions or need a resend, please call CoxNet, the
Cox News Service, at 404-526-5456.

   THE WEEKEND DUTY EDITORS ARE:

   IN ATLANTA: Tom Oder at: office, 404 526-5456; cell phone, 404
558-9612; pager 404 779-8619.

   IN WASHINGTON: Andy Alexander at: 202-887-8334.

   INTERNATIONAL

   IRAN-GAME _ TEHRAN, Iran _ World Cup fever is here. Live
coverage of reaction to the U.S. vs. Iran World Cup game being
played in France on Sunday, June 21. (Kaplow, Cox News Service).

   EDs: Both moving Sunday in both the (i) International and (s)
Sports categories.

   IRANUS _ TEHRAN, Iran _ Now that they're playing soccer
together, what are the attitudes in Iran to opening up a better
relationship with the United States. (Kaplow, Cox News Service).

   EDs: Moving in the (i) International category.

   CUPKEEPER _ Column of offbeat, interesting items.
(Tierney/Parker, Atlanta Journal-Constitution).

   EDs: Moving in the (s) Sports category.

   CUPBIOS _ Bios of an American player and top foreign player;
Today on TV; Rule Book. (Parker, Atlanta Journal-Constitution).

   EDs: Moving in the (s) Sports category.

   WASHINGTON

   TRIP _ WASHINGTON _ Behind the scenes at each leg of Clinton's
five-city tour lie countless strategy meetings, site inspections,
event consultations and back-room skull sessions . It's all the
work of a temporal team of White House schedulers, diplomats,
security agents, communications experts, transportation
specialists, physicians and even chefs who have come together in
recent months to plan the presidential trip to China. (Deans, Cox
News Service).

   BANKRUPTCY _ WASHINGTON _ What's ahead for a House-passed bill
that would force people who declare bankruptcy to pay back more of
their debts, if they can. (Harlan, Cox News Service).

   Eds: Moved in advance in the (w) Washington and (f) financial
categories.

   NORWOOD _ A look at the political intrigue surrounding Charlie
Norwood's bold proposal to reform managed health care. (Carr, Cox
News Service).

   ENTERTAINMENT-ARTS

   MULAN-EVOLVE _ A char looking at the evolution of Disney
heroines, from Ariel in ``The Little Mermaid'' to Beauty,
Pocahontas to Mulan. With Snow White or Cinderella thrown in for
historical context. (Murray, Atlanta Journal-Constitution).

   WITH

   MULAN-LEGEND _ Explaining the popular Chinese legend that
inspired ``Mulan,'' story of Chinese girl who saves her father's
life and brings honor to her family. (Murray, Atlanta
Journal-Constitution). 5-6.

   HOWIE _You know him as Howie Mandel, the standup comic who's
championed bullhorn-style wackiness for years. Today, meet Howard
Mandel, TV's newest daytime talk show host. (Harris, Atlanta
Journal-Constitution). 19.

   WITH

   HOWIE-BIO _ Bio box on Howie Mandel. (Atlanta
Journal-Constitution).

   TVSURFER-COLUMN _ Comedy Central debuts its new 'toon ``Bob and
Margaret'' from an Oscar-winning team and starts a new season of
its riotous ``Dr. Katz'' (the season debut features Denis Leary).
(Jubera, Atlanta Journal-Constitution).

   SPORTS

   BRAVES-MAIN _ MONTREAL _ Coverage of today's Braves game against
the Montreal Expos in Montreal. (Wilkinson, Atlanta
Journal-Constitution) ETA: 60 minutes after game's end.

   Eds: First pitch is at 1:35 p.m. EDT

   BRAVES-NOTEBOOK _ MONTREAL _ Inside the Braves' clubhouse.
(Wilkinson, Atlanta Journal-Constitution) ETA: 8 p.m.

   BRAVES-SIDEBAR _ MONTREAL _ Sidebar on an aspect of today's game
with the Expos. (Wilkinson, Atlanta Journal-Constitution) ETA: 8
p.m.

   BRAVES-ONDECK _ MONTREAL _ A brief preview of tomorrow's Braves
game against the Yankees in New York. (Wilkinson, Atlanta
Journal-Constitution)

   BRAVES-YANKS _ Advance setting up the Braves-Yankees series
four-game series starting Monday night in New York (two games in
New York, two in Atlanta. (Wilkinson, Atlanta
Journal-Constitution). 12.

   USOPEN _ SAN FRANCISCO _ Coverage, final round of U.S. Open.
(Sheeley, Atlanta Journal-Constitution). 14.

   USOPEN-BAR _ SAN FRANCISCO _ U.S. Open sidebar. (Sheeley,
Atlanta Journal-Constitution). 12-14.

   USOPEN-NOTEBOOK0622_ SAN FRANCISCO _ U.S. Open notebook.
(Sheeley, Atlanta Journal-Constitution). 14-16.

   USOPEN-BISHER _ SAN FRANCISCO _ Furman Bisher's column from the
US Open. (Bisher, Atlanta Journal-Constitution).

   USOPEN-NUHN 0622 _ SAN FRANCISCO _ Dayton Daily News columnist
Gary Nuhn writes about the US Open in San Francisco. (Nuhn, Dayton
Daily News)

   NASCAR-LEDE _ POCONO, Pa. _ NASCAR lead from Pocono.
(McCollister, Atlanta Journal-Constitution). 13.

   NASCAR-NOTEBOOK _ POCONO, Pa. _ NASCAR notebook. (McCollister,
Atlanta Journal-Constitution). 13.

   NASCAR-NOTEBOOK _ POCONO, Pa. _ NASCAR sidebar. (McCollister,
Atlanta Journal-Constitution). 10.

   GA-FLA 0622 _ Follow on the Georgia-Florida high school game,
including an idea officials are discussing about moving the 1999
game to December and tying it into the Peach Bowl festivities.
(Towers, Atlanta Journal-Constitution). 12.

   Story Filed By Cox Newspapers

   For Use By Clients of the New York Times News Service
